instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: does transistor, resistor size matter?
threads.message: im attempting a macbook air repair but only have macbook pro donor boards. transistor sizes are different but rating are the same. does it matter as long as i can get it on the pads?

threads.title: does transistor, resistor size matter?
threads.message:
If the values are similar enough and you can make it fit it should be alright for resistors and capacitors.

More advanced components like transistors are possible, but keep in mind not every transistor is alike. Many have slightly different specifications so always compare the datasheets, when in doubt just buy the right chip or a donor board with a matching part.
